channel.title: Learning Notes on The Outlier
channel.description: Recent content in Learning Notes on The Outlier

item.title: Einsum
item.description: signature einsum(equation, operand) where equation is a string representing the Einstein summation and operands is a sequence of tensors. how its work? free indices: indices specified in output summation indices: all other indices in input not in output example: np.einsum("ik, kj -> ij", A, B), free indices = i, j and summation index = k examples import torch x = torch.rand((2, 3)) permutation torch.einsum("ij -> ji", x) summation torch.einsum("ij ->", x)
